str2: Agrippa, i.e. Herod Agrippa II. Apparently from agrios and hippos; wild-horse tamer; Agrippas, one of the Herods.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To turn to, commit, entrust; I allow, yield, permit. From epi and the base of trope; to turn over, i.e. Allow.
(a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Gen: in behalf of; acc: above.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 2nd Person Singular

str2: Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To stretch out (forth), cast forth (as of an anchor), lay hands on. From ek and teino; to extend.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To give a defense, defend myself (especially in a law court): it can take an object of what is said in defense.
